Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
FOR CWL ONLY
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MSA and your
contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 860-0787.

ALLEGATION:
The agency failed to initiate a special investigation on the licensed foster parents
after they took in placement of a former foster child without the agency’s knowledge.
INVESTIGATION:
On 3/22/2022 I spoke with Complainant X by telephone. Complainant X reported
Child A’s birth father, Parent C took the child to Foster Parent D and Foster Parent
E, after someone contacted children services related to Child A on 9/8/2021. Child A
had been in the care of her mother, Parent B. Complainant X reported Child A
somehow ended up with bruises on her, which Complainant X reports were not on
Child A on 9/8/2021 when children services came out see Child A and Parent B.
Complainant X reported Parent C took Child A to Foster Parent D and Foster Parent
E without a court order; and children services were involved in facilitating Child A’s
placement with these foster parents under a safety plan. She reported Child A being
placed with the foster parents was without proper placement criteria’s; and Bethany
did not investigate the foster parents related to them taking the child improperly.
Additionally, that at the time, Parent C was living on Foster Parent D and Foster
Parent ‘s property, which is also improper.
On 4/8/2022 I interviewed Program Manager 2, and Foster Care Worker 3 onsite.
Licensing Supervisor 4 was contacted by Program Manager 2 while I was onsite;
and I interviewed Licensing Supervisor 4 by way of Microsoft Team’s video
conferencing.
On 4/8/2022, Program Manager (PM) reported the Department of Health and Human
Services (DHHS)-Oakland County, not Bethany has full family responsibility for Child
A’s and Parent B and Parent C’s case. She said there are three other children who
were placed with Parent B. That Parent B has a criminal case pending related to
physical maltreatment pertaining to Child A. PM 2 reported that Foster Parent D
contacted the agency to say children services placed Child A with them under a
safety plan. She said, DHHS- Oakland County children services made the
placement without Bethany’s knowledge. PM 2 reported Licensing Supervisor 3
could better explain what occurred. She reported no knowledge of Parent C ever
living on Foster Parent D’s and Parent E’s property, as alleged in the complaint.
On 4/8/2022, Licensing Supervisor 4 affirmed PM 2’s reporting related to children
services putting Child A in Foster Parent D’s and Foster Parent E’s foster home
without contacting Bethany. She reported Child A being in the foster home was not
really a foster care placement. She said the agency discovered children services
contacted the foster family and was inquiring about placement capacity prior to
3

Bethany’s knowledge of the situation. Children services had a meeting with Foster
Parent D and Foster Parent E sometime in October 2021, which may have been
before or after Foster Parent D and Foster Parent E reported the situation to
Licensing Supervisor 4 on 10/18/2021. She said, the foster parents became
concerned they were doing something wrong and called the agency. Licensing
Supervisor 4 said she reached out to the DHHS-Oakland County children services
worker on 10/18/2021 or 10/19/2021. The Children Services Specialist (CSS) X0
reported not knowing the rules; but did not disclose why they reached out to the
foster parents directly, as opposed to Bethany. Licensing Supervisor 4 reported that
due to foster home rules, Child A could not be in the foster home without official
removal from the birth home or a safety plan; nor without a borrowed bed agreement
(BBA) with Bethany. She instructed CSSW X0 on what needed to be done to
execute a BBA for Child A in Foster Parent D’s and Foster E’s foster home. She
said, the BBA was completed, effective for 10/22/2021- 1/11/2022 when Bethany
took case responsibility.
Licensing Supervisor 4 provided me a copy of that BBA which showed a 10/22/2021
verbal authorization date, as well as a 10/22/2021 effective date for the placement.
Licensing Supervisor 4 acknowledged that on 10/15/2021 Child A would have been
physically in the foster home, as reported by the foster parents. Licensing Supervisor
4 reported not knowing if Child A was in the home before 10/15/2021. She said the
foster parents reported Parent C came to the home with Child A, some time before
10/15/2021 asking for assistance. The foster parents told Parent C he should not be
there. Licensing Supervisor 4 reported not knowing if the child stayed after Parent C
came to the foster home. She reported Foster Parent D and Foster Parent E
reported they did not contact Bethany on 10/15/2021, because they thought DHHS
was communicating with Bethany. She said DHHS told the foster parents it was
okay for the child to be there. She advised the foster parents that was not true.
She reported Foster Parent D and Foster Parent E were Child A’s prior foster
parents; and after Child A went home, the foster parents maintained a
relationship/contact with Child A and Child A’s birth parents. She said the foster
parents would have insinuated Child A was placed there on a safety plan but that is
not true because there was no communication from DHHS with Bethany until
Licensing Supervisor 4 reached out to DHHS after Child A was in the home. She
said Bethany would not have completed a body chart on Child A during that time
because there was no concerns or reasons to ask about that because Bethany had
not yet received the child’s case. She also reported no knowledge of Parent C ever
living on Foster Parent D’s and Parent E’s property, as alleged in the complaint.
On 4/8/2022, Foster Care Worker (FCW) 3 affirmed PM 2’s reporting related to not
being aware of Parent C ever having lived on the foster parents’ property.
On 4/14/2022. I interviewed Foster Parent D by telephone. Foster Parent D reported
being a licensed foster parent for 10 years. She reported Child A was officially
placed in her’s and Foster Parent E’s home on 10/22/2021. Prior to that Child A was
4

in the home under other circumstances. Foster Parent D reported that Parent C
showed up to their home on Sunday, 9/5/2021, reporting he had gotten kicked out of
his home; and Parent B was beating on Child A. She advised they had been
supportive to Child A’s birth family in the past and had communicated on and off with
them. She and Foster Parent E provided Parent C a hotel room; but Parent C kept
calling them about things that was happening. Parent C was scared and panicking
as to what to do related to what he reported was maltreatment occurring to Child A,
so they advised Parent C to contact the police. Parent C did so, and the police
advised Parent C of his right related to Child A. On 9/8/2021 Parent C arranged
something with Parent B; and Parent C acquired Child A. Parent C brought Child A
to her and Foster Parent E. Child A was in their care from 9/8/2021 onward because
Parent C asked them to keep Child A.
Foster Parent D said, children services visited their home the evening of 9/8/2021 to
see if Child A was okay. She acknowledged children services did not mandate that
they keep Child A in their home, but children services checked the home because
Parent C told them this is where Child A would be living. Therefore, children services
was approving this setting for Child A at that time. Additionally, children services did
not tell her they would reach out to Bethany, nor advised her to contact Bethany.
Foster Parent D reported contacting her worker, on 10/8/2021 and advising the
worker of Child A being in the home and them working with Children Services
Worker 5. Foster Parent D did not contact Bethany when Child A first came to be
living in the home, because they did not know when or if Child A might officially
come into foster care. They “just thought it was an emergency situation”. That it was
only going to be for a couple of days. They were trying to help Parent C to get a
place to stay. Foster Parent D reported, sometime after, children services and the
police stopped communicating with them, they reached out to Bethany’s licensing
staff in early October 2021 to ask them if they could help related to the placement.
Foster Parent D reported they were not trying to keep Child A’s placement in their
home a secret. They thought children services and DHHS were the same and were
communicating with one another. She thought that if an officially placement was
warranted, DHHS would complete the BBA, if it led to that. I asked Foster Parent D
whether home visits occurred by Bethany workers while Child A was in the home,
prior to her contact with the worker on 10/8/2021. Foster Parent D reported Worker
6 had seen Child A in the home. She told Worker 6, she was helping out a friend;
and it was a long story.
I asked Foster Parent D whether Parent C was living on their property at any time.
Foster Parent D admitted Parent C had. She explained that Parent C was never in
the home. He stayed in the back of their property in a fifth Wheeler (A trailer that is
behind or pulled by a truck) located with the cars. Parent C stayed there for a few
days, whenever he was not in a hotel. She said, as of 10/15/2021, when the safety
plan was put in place, Parent C was off their property entirely. This was shared with
Bethany; Bethany helped put the safety plan in place. Foster Parent D stated “I
shared all this with Bethany when I reached out to them. I told them the whole story.”
5

On 4/19/2022, I spoke with Children Services Specialist (CSS) X0 by telephone.
CSS X0 reported they did not place Child A into Foster Parent D’s and Foster Parent
E’s home. The complaint was with the birth parents; and Parent C had put Child A
with these foster parents. CSS X0 said they did not initially know Foster Parent D
and Foster Parent E were foster parents, they thought the foster parents were
friends of Parent C. CSS X0 reported their department was just assessing the
safety plan Parent C was purposing for Child A, whom he had taken custody of. CSS
X0 said her department was just giving support for Parent C’s safety plan. They did
not force or tell Foster Parent D and Foster Parent E they must keep Child A. “All
was voluntary until the court got involved.” A couple days after her contact with
Foster Parent D and Foster Parent F she became aware that the couple were
licensed foster parents. She reported she did not reach out to Bethany about what
was happening, because she did not know to do so. She did know the protocol or
issues related to a BBA. Bethany/ Licensing Supervisor 4 reached out to her. She
recalled something about a BBA, but not the specific. She reported, there was a
meeting sometime later in October, whereby the foster parents were in attendance,
but by that time she was no longer the worker; the case had gone back to the
previous children services worker.
Reviewed:
 Child A’s MISACWIS case record which showed Child A (now age 4) was
placed with Foster Parent D and Foster Parent E on 10/22/2021- 1/11/2022;
then 1/11/2022 to present. It also showed Child A was previously placed with
these foster parents on 11/9/2017- 11/16/2017; then again on 12/11/2017-
6/25/2019 when Child A was returned home.
 Bethany’s borrowed bed agreement with DHHS-Oakland County for Child A.
The agreement is signed by Bethany and DHHS- Oakland County on
10/22/2021.
 Foster Parent D’s and Foster Parent E’s MISACWIS provider record which
showed two 10/18/2021 social contacts by way of email and phone contact
with Foster Parent D by Worker 6:
 In the first social work contact that was by email, it indicated it was for
purposes of introducing the new worker; and to address sleeping/ bedding
concerns, and options. That during the conversation, Foster Parent D
reported she took a previous child back into her home as a safety plan
created with children services. Worker 6 advised Foster Parent D she
should notify her licensing worker within 24 hours of any changes to the
home. During the conversation, Foster Parent D reported that she had
notified her foster care worker “K” that Child A had been placed since last
Tuesday (which was 10/12/2021).
 In the second social work contact that was by telephone, it indicated the
worker informed Foster Parent D, that Foster Parent D needed to send the
children services worker's contact information to ensure follow up could be
had, due to children services not being able to place a child, without talking
with the agency first.
6

 Child A’s MISACWIS case record which showed a children services 10/12/2021
social work contact entered on 10/29/2021 which indicated:
 A scheduled visit was conducted at Foster Parent D’s home to meet with
Parent C and verify the well-being of Child A. The well-being of Child A was
documented, and the contact indicated Child A appeared very comfortable
with Foster Parent D and another child in the home.
 During the home visit information was taken from Parent C related to Child
A’s children services allegation for the beginning of September. How Parent
C intervened with the police; left his home and subsequently removed Child
A from the home the same day.
 Additionally, that a safety plan was established and agreed upon by Parent
C. Parent C agreed to have Child A remain in the home of Foster Parent D.
Parent C agreed to have supervised visits only with the child. He agreed to
be available for all of her needs. This contact indicated this safety plan
meant that Parent C would leave Foster Parent D’s and Foster Parent E’s
home; and he agreed to do this.
 A social ork contact of a telephone call with a worker at Bethany on 10/8/2021 was
not documented.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in
the agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(b) Initiate a special evaluation of the foster home as
soon as is indicated, based on the information received, but
not later than 7 calendar days after receipt of the
information.
ANALYSIS: The evidence showed the foster parents took Child A into their
home on 9/8/2021, prior to 10/18/2021. The foster parents made
the information about Child A being in the home known to the
agency after the fact on 10/8/2021 and or 10/18/2021.
As of 10/18/2021, the agency knew Child A had been in the
foster home prior to 10/18/2021 without proper notice to the
agency. The agency did not initiate a special evaluation to
investigate a possible rule violation or the circumstances of
Child A’s presence in the home. Nor the birth father’s
involvement related to the child’s placement in the home or his
possible presence in the home, or on the property, the latter of
which Foster Parent D confirmed.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
7

ALLEGATION:
The agency failed to look for any relative placements. Additionally, the agency has
not provided services to Parent B or informed the birth parents of medical
appointments for the child.
INVESTIGATION:
Complainant X reported that Child A’s case plan is reunification and Parent B has
not seen her child since 9/8/2022. Further that Bethany has not made contact with
Parent B and has not tried to provide services to the birth parents. Nor is the agency
alerting Parent B of medical appointments for Child A. Complainant X reported
Parent B is on probation for two years, and reports this was based on testimony from
Foster Parent D related to an alleged statement by Parent B that, “the baby is dead
to her”. Complainant X reported the foster parent also took Child A for a Trauma
Assessment without alerting the birth parents. Additionally, that Bethany is letting
the foster parents get away with all of this. Complainant X expressed concern that
the foster parents, and Bethany are not concern with the other children. Compliant X
reported it is all just a “set up to get Child A (for adoption) and that the worker lied in
court. Complainant X did not clarity what the worker lie about. Nor did Complainant
X report concern related to the agency having explored or not explored a relative
placement for Child A.
Program Manager 2 reported DHHS has full family responsibility for Child A’s case;
and the agency has been working with DHHS related to the case and the special
circumstances related to it.
Foster Care Worker (FCW) 3 affirmed PM 2’s reporting related to DHHS having full
family responsibility. She said DHHS made the referral for Child A’s trauma
assessment. Additionally, DHHS was offering and providing services to Parent B
and Parent B had been completing those services. FCW 3 reported Bethany had a
meeting with DHHS related to the case plan. DHHS was trying to decide whether
they would continue with the case. She reported Bethany’s responsibility for Child A’
case was effective 1/11/2022. She said Parent B has a two year no contact order
in place related to Child A. She said Child A has yet to be adjudicated as a ward of
the court.
FCW 3 reported the agency had not officially offered services to Parent B or Parent
C because DHHS, not Bethany has full family responsibility. She said DHHS
referred Parent B to counseling services. She said Bethany has had contact with
Parent C and is offering parenting time. Bethany will also be offering him services.
She said she has also reached out to Parent B at least three times; asking if she had
questions. Parent B does not want contact with Bethany. As for the agency not
seeking out relatives or informing Parent B or Parent C of medical appointments for
Child A. FCW 3 reported Parent C approved the placement with the foster parents;
8

and no medical appointments have occurred since Bethany took over Child A’s
case. All other appointments were handled by DHHS; inclusive of DHHS scheduling
Child A’s 1/31/2022 trauma assessment. Therein, all notification related those past
scheduled appointments would have been DHHS’s responsibility. FCW 3 reported it
was true that Foster Parent A took Child A for a 1/31/2022 trauma assessment. She
also attended the trauma assessment, because it and her attendance at the trauma
assessment was court ordered. She said the trauma assessment would have been
indicated and or discussed at court, and thereby the birth parents would have known
about the appointment. FCW 3 further reported that its true that Child A is in
counseling and that too was referred by DHHS-Oakland County. Bethany followed
up on it; and Child A had an intake and has had three therapy sessions (at the time
of FCW 3’s interview).
FCW 3 reported Child A’s case plan remains reunification. She reported with respect
to Foster Parent D making some statement in court related to Parent B, that was at
Parent B’s criminal case. The agency is not aware of how the criminal case came to
be, but the Foster Parent D was asked by the prosecutor to give an “impact
statement”, and Foster Parent D did so. After the hearing, a male, reported to be
related to Parent B threatened the foster parent; and thereafter put the foster
parents’ photo and address on social media, asking someone to hurt them. The
foster parent did not set out to do anything to cause harm to the birth parent.
On 4/19/2022 I spoke with DHHS-Oakland County FCW XX by telephone. She is
the family worker and foster care worker for Child A’s three siblings. She affirmed
that DHHS has full family responsibility for this case. She reported she and FCW 3
work together with respect to tangible related services. She said adjudication was
pending related to Child A, and services were placed on the records for Parent C at
the last hearing, in April 2022. She said, the court has not made requirements of
Parent B as of yet. A no contact order remains in place for Parent B. Bethany’s
FCW 3 was at the last court hearing.
Reviewed:
 Child A’s MISACWIS case record which showed:
 Bethany, per a DHS-3600(Case Referral and Acceptance, Individual
Service Agreement) accepted Child A’s case on 1/11/2022.
 A 10/22/2021 Interim Placement court order, alleging repeated and
substantial maltreatment by Parent B and ordering that DHHS take Child
A into protective custody
 Child A’s 11/20/2021- 2/17/2022 updated service plan completed by
Bethany which showed:
 Parenting time had been suspended by the court pending a trauma
assessment for Child A.
 A 2/10/2022 social work contact/ for a FTM (Family Team Meeting)
attended by Parent B, and her attorney, Parent C and his attorney,
the children service worker, Worker 5, DHHS- Oakland County
FCW XX; FCW 3; and an unnamed parent partner. During this FTM
9

there was discussions by the attorneys, FCW 3 updated the group
that she still is awaiting the outcome of the 1/31/2022 trauma
assessment, and gave a status updated of Child A’s therapy which
began 1/7/2022. FCW 3 also provided the name and contact
information for the therapist to all the FTM attendees. Additionally,
FCW 3 apprised the attendees that Child A is on a wait list
pertaining to Child A’s court-ordered psychological assessment. A
parenting time schedule was explored during this FTM session
without resolution during the FTM due to the attorneys, and parents
arguing over such arrangements.
 Reunification is the permanency goal. Parent B and Parent C must
obtain and maintain housing, employment, and mental health
services. Both parents will participate in some form of parenting
classes. Parenting time will remain suspended until further order
from the court.
 Telephone contacts with Parent B and Parent C by FCW 3 in January 2022
and with Parent C also in April 2022.
 Child A’s 9/10/2021, 10/29/2021; 11/29/2021 medical exams; 11/15/2021
dental exam was prior to Bethany’s 1/11/2022 acceptance of the case, as
reported by FCW 3.
 DHHS- Oakland County has full case responsibility and numerous contacts
on the case, with Parent B and Parent C by the county worker.
APPLICABLE RULE
FOM 913-5 Placement Resources: Child Placing Agency Family
Responsibility
Family Responsibility:
The contractor shall provide all needed services to a family unit
for the purpose of reunification and/or permanency planning.
Services shall include placement planning and preparation,
service referrals for parents and children, the arrangement and
facilitation of family visitations (including the provision of
transportation as needed) as well as court responsibility
10

ANALYSIS: Bethany is not the primary service agency; it does not have full
family responsibility. DHHS-Oakland County has.
Bethany has maintained contacts with the DHHS- Oakland
County service worker; and has had contacts with the parents
related to exploring if they had questions, and exploration for
parenting time if approved by the court. The agency also
followed through with service referrals for Child A as put in place
by DHHS prior to the Bethany’s case acceptance.
There is insufficient evidence to support the allegations.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan continuation of the agency’s
current licensing status is recommended.
